title: README.md
description: How I built this website and my future plans.

body.raw: I've build this website in less than two days with a clear goal in mind: to create a personal space on the internet where I could share my thoughts, showcase my work, and connect with like-minded individuals. Here's a detailed look into how I brought this vision to life: ### Technology Stack - **Frontend Framework**: I opted for Next.js, a powerful React framework that offers server-side rendering, automatic code splitting, and easy deployment. Its versatility and performance optimizations make it ideal for building modern web applications. - **UI Design**: The user interface is crafted using ui.shadcn, a sophisticated UI library that enhances aesthetics and user experience with its modern design principles and component variety. - **Typography**: The website utilizes Inter, a versatile sans-serif font designed for optimal readability on digital screens. Its open-source nature and aesthetic appeal make it a perfect choice for enhancing content presentation. ### Backend Setup - **Markdown**: I've integrated Contentlayer, a content SDK that enables me to manage and update website content seamlessly using Markdown files. This simplifies content management and allows me to focus on creating engaging content without worrying about complex backend setups. - **Email**: I've implemented Resend, a email platform crafted for developers, to handle email subscriptions and notifications. This ensures reliable email delivery and seamless integration with my website's backend. ### Infrastructure - **Hosting**: The website is securely hosted on Vercel, a platform known for its seamless deployment workflow, automatic scaling, and global CDN support. This ensures fast loading times and reliable performance across different regions. - **Domain**: My personalized domain is managed through AWS Route 53, ensuring robust DNS management and reliable routing to my website's servers. ### Analytics - **Analytics**: The website utilizes [Posthog](https://posthog.com), an open-source product analytics platform that provides valuable insights into user behavior, engagement metrics, and content performance. This data-driven approach helps me optimize the website for better user experiences. --- --- ## Future Plans Looking ahead, I have exciting plans to further develop and expand this website's features and content. Some future initiatives include: - **Interactive Features**: Introducing interactive elements such as user comments, real-time updates, and personalized user experiences. - **Enhanced Content**: Publishing more in-depth articles, tutorials, and projects related to my areas of interest and expertise. - **Community Engagement**: Building a community around shared interests, fostering discussions, and collaborating with like-minded individuals. --- ### Note This website is a reflection of my passion for technology. I'm committed to continuously improving and expanding this platform to provide valuable content, engage with the community, and share my journey in the tech industry. I've also open-sourced the codebase for this website on GitHub. Thank you for visiting, stay tuned for more updates!

title: Software and Tools I Use
description: A detailed look into the technology stack I use daily.

body.raw: I've been building (complexier) software over 6 years and have experimented with a variety of tools and technologies. Here's a detailed look into the software and tools I use daily: ### Always with me - Macbook Pro M1 Max 16" (2020) - iPhone 13 ### Productivity - **Note-taking**: I use Notion for organizing my thoughts, tasks, and projects. - **Task Management**: I rely on Superlist for managing my daily tasks and projects. - **Calendar**: I use Fantastical for managing my calendar and scheduling events. - **Focus**: I use Opal for blocking distracting websites and apps during work hours. ### Development Tools - **Code Editor**: I use Visual Studio Code for all types of development tasks. It's fast, extensible, and has a vibrant ecosystem of extensions. - **Terminal**: It may sound old-school, but I prefer the macOS default Terminal for most of my command-line tasks. ### Frontend Development - **Framework**: I work with Next.js for all types of projects. Absolutely my go-to choice! - **Styling**: I use TailwindCSS for rapid prototyping and styling components. - **Component Library**: I use ui.shadcn for building accessible and responsive UI components. ### Backend Development - **Server**: I work with Node.js for server-side development. - **Database**: I use primarily MongoDB for NoSQL databases and PostgreSQL for relational databases. - **Deployment**: I deploy applications on Vercel, Azure, and AWS ### Design and Prototyping - **Design Tools**: I work with [Figma](https://www.figma.com) for UI/UX design and prototyping. - **Management**: I use Linear for managing design tasks and projects. --- ### Programming Languages - **C/C++**: I have experience with C/C++ for low-level programming tasks. - **JavaScript**: I work with JavaScript for frontend and backend development. - **TypeScript**: I use TypeScript for type-safe JavaScript development. - **Python**: I use Python for scripting and data analysis tasks. - **Rust**: I'm learning Rust for systems programming and performance-critical tasks. - **SQL**: I work with SQL for database management and querying. --- ### Conclusion This is a high-level overview of the software and tools I use daily. I'm always open to trying new tools and technologies to improve my workflow. If you have any suggestions or recommendations, feel free to reach out to me on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/gabfon_).
